availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Hardy Curd (Calloway County, KY, farmer and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Emily J. Curd. Father of John L. Curd, Thomas G. Curd, Francis J. Curd, Edmund Curd, William Curd, Orlando F. Curd, Lanius Curd, Flavius Curd, Maximus Curd, Jefferson Emmett Curd, and Paron Ann Curd. Farmer in Calloway County in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 457A.
